answers.answer: Hi,Thanks for writing in.Since neurological causes have been ruled out it is important to consider other possibilities like peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes, or B12 deficiency, nerve compression in the lower back, fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome.I would suggest you to discuss these possibilities with your doctor and see if it helps!

question: No diagnosis and I'm frustrated.  For 6 months I've been having tests -- all results fine:  brain MRI, back MRI, blood work of many kinds, including rare syndromes.  I am strong and slim and love to walk.  Some days I walk the speed of a turtle.  Some days I use a walker/rollator to do my walk.  My arms and legs "buzz" deep inside.  For a few weeks I could walk normal.  A couple of times I have had a weird high-stepping gate.  I have occasionally had balance problems while walking.  I have not been comfortable to drive my car for past 6 months -- get startled to easily.
title: occasional gait disturbance, tingling in arms,legs
